Package chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class maintains the chess board throughout the execution of the program. It contains methods for initializing the board with the correct format, maintaining the current player's turn, and other functions and rules that need to be enforced throughout a round of play.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean blackResigns
      This is a boolean to maintain if the black player has resigned.
      boolean blackWantsDraw
      This is a boolean to hold true if black has requested a draw.
      Tile[][] chessBoard
      This is a global variable that maintains the state of the chess board.
      boolean gameIsDone
      This is a boolean to remain false until the game is over.
      boolean whiteResigns
      This is a boolean to maintain if the white player has resigned.
      boolean whitesMove
      This is a boolean to hold the current color's turn.
      boolean whiteWantsDraw
      This is a boolean to hold true if white has requested a draw.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      This is a constructor that accepts no parameters and returns an instance of a Board object, or in other words, a chess board.

    • Method Detail

      • isWhitesMove

        public boolean isWhitesMove()
        This is a getter method that will return the boolean that holds true if it is white's turn.
        Returns:
        true if it is indeed white's turn, false otherwise (meaning it is black's turn).

      • switchPlayer

        public void switchPlayer()
        This method sets the boolean that holds true if it is white's turn to its inverse, symbolically switching players.

      • promptPlayer

        public void promptPlayer()
        This method prompts for a player's move, either black's or white's.

      • checkInputFormat

        public boolean checkInputFormat​(java.lang.String input)
        This method checks to see if the correct filerank input format is followed, and returns true if so.
        Parameters:
        input - is the inputted string move from the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        true if input is in the form "FileRank FileRank", where the first file (column) and rank (row) are the coordinates of the piece to be moved, and the second file and rank are the coordinates of where it should end up.

      • readInput

        public boolean readInput​(java.lang.String input)
        This method is meant to interpret the user input, i.e. whether or not the player wants to resign, or asks for a draw, etc, and will also check if the move being requested by a player is valid (whether a piece can move to a certain board location or not, depending on the current board layout).
        Parameters:
        input - is the inputted string move from the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        true if input is valid for either requesting a draw, resigning, executing a move/special move, or any other variation that would require a change in the board or one of the pieces, false if input is incorrect.

      • resetCastling

        public void resetCastling()
        This method will reset the possibility for a player to perform 'castling' between a king and rook if it meets the specific requisites, detailed in the official chess rules.

      • checkForEnpassant

        public void checkForEnpassant​(int startRow,
                              int startColumn,
                              int endRow,
                              int endColumn,
                              Tile[][] board)
        This method will check the board for pawns that can be captured via enpassant, and set the fields to true within the respective pawn objects if true.
        Parameters:
        startRow - basic parameters for system to see current layout of board
        startColumn -
        endRow -
        endColumn -
        chessboard -

      • resetEnpassant

        public void resetEnpassant()
        This method will reset the pawn fields for being able to be enpassanted to false if the board sees that the next player made a move and did not capitalize on the enpassantable pawn.

      • dealWithWhiteCheck

        input - basic parameters for system to see state of board & to understand what moves the white player can make.

      • blackCheckMate

        public boolean blackCheckMate​(java.lang.String input,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> blackMoves)
        This method will check if the black player is in checkmate.
        Parameters:
        input - basic parameters for system to see state of board & to understand if the black player has lost.
        blackMoves -
        Returns:
        true if white player is in checkmate and has lost.

        public boolean updateBoard​(int startRow,
                           int startColumn,
                           int endRow,
                           int endColumn,
                           java.lang.String input)
        This method will call the native update methods in each respective Piece class in order to update the overall board
        Parameters:
        startRow - basic parameters for system to see state of board & to understand what moves the player can make.
        startColumn -
        endRow -
        endColumn -
        input -
        Returns:
        true if this move is able to be made and board was able to be updated, false if otherwise.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(int startRow,
                           int startColumn,
                           int endRow,
                           int endColumn,
                           Tile[][] board)
        This method will check if the move involving the piece is valid, meaning the piece can move in such a fashion.
        Parameters:
        startRow - basic parameters for system to see state of board & to understand what is valid.
        startColumn -
        endRow -
        endColumn -
        board -
        Returns:
        true if this move is able to be made and piece can move in such a fashion, false if otherwise.

      • getValidWhiteMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getValidWhiteMoves​(Tile[][] board)
        This method finds all the moves any white piece can make at its turn during any portion of the game. This will help in eventually determining if a player is in check/checkmate or can evade it.
        Parameters:
        board - in order to see current state of board and traverse across it
        Returns:
        whitemovelist which will detail all the moves that any white piece can make at any moment in the game

      • getValidBlackMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getValidBlackMoves​(Tile[][] board)
        This method finds all the moves any black piece can make at its turn during any portion of the game. This will help in eventually determining if a player is in check/checkmate or can evade it.
        Parameters:
        board - in order to see current state of board and traverse across it
        Returns:
        blackmovelist which will detail all the moves that any black piece can make at any moment in the game

      • findPieceMovesWhite

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> findPieceMovesWhite​(int w,
                                                                                       int x,
                                                                                       Tile[][] board)
        This method finds all the valid moves any white piece can make that doesn't put its king in check.
        Parameters:
        w - in order to see current state of board and traverse across movable pieces
        x -
        board -
        Returns:
        validwhitemovelist which will detail all the moves that any white piece can make that are valid and will complete their turn.

        public boolean whiteInCheck​(Tile[][] board)
